sentences: Yukihiro, stylized as yukihiro and previously stylized as YUKIHIRO, (born November 24, 1968, in Ichikawa, Chiba) is a Japanese musician, best known as drummer of the rock band L'Arc-en-Ciel.
section: N/A

sentences: He also sings and plays bass for his solo project, Acid Android.
section: N/A

sentences: Before joining L'Arc-en-Ciel he was in the popular visual kei bands
section: N/A

sentences: Zi:Kill and Die in Cries.
section: N/A

sentences: Biography ==
section: == Biography ==

sentences: Early life =
section: == Biography == | === Early life ===
== Biography == | === Early life ===

sentences: Yukihiro was born on November 24, 1968, in Ichikawa, near Tokyo.
section: == Biography == | === Early life ===

sentences: His father is a company worker, and his mother is a kimono-wearing instructor.
section: == Biography == | === Early life ===

sentences: He has a younger sister.
section: == Biography == | === Early life ===

sentences: Yukihiro has stated that he had as ordinary a childhood as any other kid, never questioning his destined path of going to school, graduating to a university, and ultimately becoming a white-collar salaryman.
section: == Biography == | === Early life ===

sentences: But he loved music, both Japanese and American, from heavy metal to pop.
section: == Biography == | === Early life ===

sentences: He was also a good short-track athlete in junior high school.
section: == Biography == | === Early life ===

sentences: However, he was kicked out from his athletics club for skipping daily training.
section: == Biography == | === Early life ===

sentences: When he entered high school, he started to play the drums and immediately decided to be a professional rock musician.
section: == Biography == | === Early life ===

sentences: Once he made the decision, he told his parents that he was leaving school because it was of no use to him.
section: == Biography == | === Early life ===

sentences: His parents forbade this, thus he continued his education while devoting himself mostly to rock music.
section: == Biography == | === Early life ===

sentences: During his university days (he left The Chiba University of Commerce), he joined Zi:Kill, one of the rising visual kei rock groups of the time.
section: == Biography == | === Early life ===

== Biography == | === 1990–1996: Zi:Kill and Die in Cries ===

sentences: Zi:Kill and Die in Cries =
section: == Biography == | === 1990–1996: Zi:Kill and Die in Cries ===
== Biography == | === 1990–1996: Zi:Kill and Die in Cries ===

sentences: Zi:Kill signed a recording contract with Toshiba EMI in 1990.
section: == Biography == | === 1990–1996: Zi:Kill and Die in Cries ===

sentences: However, during the recording of their major debut, there was infighting and ultimately yukihiro was fired after a show in December.
section: == Biography == | === 1990–1996: Zi:Kill and Die in Cries ===

sentences: He then formed a band named Optic Nerve with guitarist Shin Murohime.
section: == Biography == | === 1990–1996: Zi:Kill and Die in Cries ===

sentences: In 1991, he joined former D'erlanger vocalist Kyo's band Die in Cries together with Shin, who released their debut album Nothing to Revolution that same year.
section: == Biography == | === 1990–1996: Zi:Kill and Die in Cries ===

sentences: They became quite popular and performed at the Nippon Budokan in 1994.
section: == Biography == | === 1990–1996: Zi:Kill and Die in Cries ===

sentences: Yukihiro wrote some songs for the band, but they were rejected because of their style.
section: == Biography == | === 1990–1996: Zi:Kill and Die in Cries ===

sentences: Some of these songs, "Trick" and "L'heure"  were later recorded by L'Arc-en-Ciel in 1999.
section: == Biography == | === 1990–1996: Zi:Kill and Die in Cries ===

sentences: Die in Cries broke up in 1995, with their last album Seed.
section: == Biography == | === 1990–1996: Zi:Kill and Die in Cries ===

sentences: For a while, yukihiro worked as a free-lance drummer.
section: == Biography == | === 1990–1996: Zi:Kill and Die in Cries ===

sentences: During that time, he had no home and moved around staying with friends.
section: == Biography == | === 1990–1996: Zi:Kill and Die in Cries ===

sentences: Tetsu stated it was so hard to catch yukihiro then, because he had no mobile phone and was always on the move.
section: == Biography == | === 1990–1996: Zi:Kill and Die in Cries ===
== Biography == | === 1997–present: L'Arc-en-Ciel, Acid Android and Petit Brabancon ===

sentences: 1997–present: L'Arc-en-Ciel, Acid Android and Petit Brabancon =
section: == Biography == | === 1997–present: L'Arc-en-Ciel, Acid Android and Petit Brabancon ===
== Biography == | === 1997–present: L'Arc-en-Ciel, Acid Android and Petit Brabancon ===

sentences: When it was announced that the former L'Arc drummer Sakura left in 1997, Tetsu, the leader of the band, asked yukihiro to help record the new single.
section: == Biography == | === 1997–present: L'Arc-en-Ciel, Acid Android and Petit Brabancon ===

sentences: During that time, they had good chemistry.
section: == Biography == | === 1997–present: L'Arc-en-Ciel, Acid Android and Petit Brabancon ===

sentences: So after their first "come-back" single, "Niji", was released, they held a comeback concert with Yukihiro as support drummer.
section: == Biography == | === 1997–present: L'Arc-en-Ciel, Acid Android and Petit Brabancon ===

sentences: In 1998, the band announced Yukihiro as an official member with the new single "Winter Fall", followed by the album Heart.
section: == Biography == | === 1997–present: L'Arc-en-Ciel, Acid Android and Petit Brabancon ===

sentences: After joining L'Arc-en-Ciel, he changed the stylization of his name to all lowercase letters, to match the rest of the members' names (his name had been written in all capital letters prior).
section: == Biography == | === 1997–present: L'Arc-en-Ciel, Acid Android and Petit Brabancon ===

sentences: Despite some arguments from Sakura's fans, yukihiro quickly got accepted to L'Arc.
section: == Biography == | === 1997–present: L'Arc-en-Ciel, Acid Android and Petit Brabancon ===

sentences: His first song, "A Swell in the Sun", was played as a prologue during their 1998 tour.
section: == Biography == | === 1997–present: L'Arc-en-Ciel, Acid Android and Petit Brabancon ===

sentences: L'Arc-en-Ciel quickly became one of the most popular rock bands in Japan.
section: == Biography == | === 1997–present: L'Arc-en-Ciel, Acid Android and Petit Brabancon ===

sentences: Their tour was sold out, the album went platinum and all seven of their singles hit the top 10 in the charts.
section: == Biography == | === 1997–present: L'Arc-en-Ciel, Acid Android and Petit Brabancon ===

sentences: On July 1, 1999, they released their sixth and seventh albums Ark and Ray on the same day.
section: == Biography == | === 1997–present: L'Arc-en-Ciel, Acid Android and Petit Brabancon ===

sentences: The albums hit the top two ranks, and the tour was a huge success.
section: == Biography == | === 1997–present: L'Arc-en-Ciel, Acid Android and Petit Brabancon ===

sentences: L'Arc-en-Ciel stopped activities until 2003 and each member started their own solo projects.
section: == Biography == | === 1997–present: L'Arc-en-Ciel, Acid Android and Petit Brabancon ===

sentences: Yukihiro started Acid Android, where he is the singer.
section: == Biography == | === 1997–present: L'Arc-en-Ciel, Acid Android and Petit Brabancon ===

sentences: L'Arc-en-Ciel came back with the single, "Ready Steady Go!", and album, Smile, after the three-year hiatus in 2004.
section: == Biography == | === 1997–present: L'Arc-en-Ciel, Acid Android and Petit Brabancon ===

sentences: Then followed up with Awake and "Link" in 2005.
section: == Biography == | === 1997–present: L'Arc-en-Ciel, Acid Android and Petit Brabancon ===

sentences: In 2007, L'Arc-en-Ciel released the single called "My Heart Draws a Dream" and album Kiss
section: == Biography == | === 1997–present: L'Arc-en-Ciel, Acid Android and Petit Brabancon ===

sentences: The group also released the single "Drink It Down" in January 2008, with the music composed by yukihiro.
section: == Biography == | === 1997–present: L'Arc-en-Ciel, Acid Android and Petit Brabancon ===

sentences: In 2021, Yukihiro formed the supergroup Petit Brabancon with Kyo, Miya (Mucc), antz (Acid Android), and Hirofumi Takamatsu (The Novembers).
section: == Biography == | === 1997–present: L'Arc-en-Ciel, Acid Android and Petit Brabancon ===
